abstract: The regulations, if approved, could require American companies like Google and Yahoo to seek clearance before complying with United States warrants seeking private data.
snippet: The regulations, if approved, could require American companies like Google and Yahoo to seek clearance before complying with United States warrants seeking private data.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — A panel of European Union lawmakers on Monday night backed a measure that could require American companies like Google and Yahoo to seek clearance from European officials before complying with United States warrants seeking private data.

headline.main: Rules Shielding Online Data From N.S.A. and Other Prying Eyes Advance in Europe
headline.print_headline: Rules Shielding Online Data from N.S.A. and Other Prying Eyes Advance in Europe
